column13: > The LEGO Batman Movie is still going strong with sets, this year they created a Polybag with a 3-1 build&hellip
column14: unfortunately you can only build one of the three models with the parts in the set, and require three copies of this one set to build the actual Ultimate Batmobile in miniature form.

column18: 1 Model choice fairly unique for a Polybag.

column16: >Instructions for the other two portions of the Ultimate Batmobile are found online.
>Cannot build all three models in one Polybag to create the actual Ultimate Batmobile.
>Forcing you to purchase three copies just to make the actually complete model as seen on the package is rather poorly done.

column8: >I enjoyed what I saw of this Polybag, the vehicles in question are all fairly decent representations of three fourths of the larger model found in the Ultimate Batmobile. There are a lot of negatives to this though, if you don&rsquo
column9: t buy three copies, or have exact parts from other sets in your collection you cannot build The Ultimate Batmobile, you can only make either the Batmobile portion, the Bat-Tank or the Batwing.

column8: >So can I recommend this set? Honestly, yes, despite its flaws all three models are very well designed, they do a great job of making it possible to build three sections and connecting them together at such a small scale. The fact that you need extra parts in your collection or have to buy three of them at once to avoid them selling out before you get the other two is a huge downer, though it does explain why this set sold out at my local TRU in such a short time.
